1. In a small bowl, mix together the baking soda and citric acid.
2. Add the water to the mixture and stir until it forms a thick paste.
3. Gradually add the vegetable oil to the paste, stirring constantly until it is fully incorporated.

2. Fill a small container with enough of the mixture to fill the plastic bottle cap.

Creating the Smoke:
1. Light the top of the smoke bomb by focusing a lighter or match flame onto the mixture. Make sure not to light the surrounding area.
2. Once the smoke bomb starts producing smoke, gently rotate the plastic bottle cap back and forth to distribute the smoke evenly.
3. Continue to do this until the smoke is fully dispersed, then carefully remove any remaining residue from the plastic bottle cap.

The baking soda reacts with the air and water, creating a thick cloud of white smoke that will dissipate slowly.
